intro: Elatinoides dichondrifolia, commonly known as the slender dichondria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal areas. Elatinoides dichondrifolia is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of its local ecosystem.
